title: 70+% of your community is below Gold. Have you played ranked recently?
body:
This snowball meta is ridiculous. Practically every game feels completely one-sided. A single kill, or gank can completely destroy any laner. Once ahead, masteries make trades even more punishing and with towers being paper thin, the game is often decided before 15 minutes. Having small mistakes be so punishable has made ranked a less competitive experience, especially in low elo.

Adding all of that to the amount of champions that can abuse masteries, all of the balance issues... Honestly masteries need to be reverted and changed so that they don't create so many balance issues. Balancing champions around which mastery is best on them is stupid.

So, is that healthy gameplay? Making a single mistake is now somehow turning you into a position of "afk under tower and hope for the team to carry you"?

That doesn't seem like healthy gameplay to me. At the same time, one kill isn't always that hard to come back from. It's more about the players' skill gap itself, rather than 300 gold.

Except it's not a single mistake. Why do people always say this? Player in lower elos do not have the ability to win lane after a single mistake. They just don't. There are a shit ton of opportunities to get back into the game after making a mistake, I do it all the time.

The problem is that players die and then continue to all in the enemy like hurr durrs.

Or don't put yourself in the position to take damage lol? the only time you can't help it is basically against artillery mages, but they're not going to proc thunderlord's on you with one poke. 

You don't HAVE to get that cs, even if it's under your tower. If you're going to take a full rotation for 3 casters, just don't. Accept that they're ahead and that you have to sacrifice gold.

I'm in bronze, I know how to zone against melee, or freeze waves, or shove when backing or leaving for objectives.
The problem is the objectives. 
I've had games where we would ace, their jungler was up in 11 secs and we have free baron. Instead, they began pushing the wave to enemy turret when the wave was near our inner turret. This is a waste of time. If they pushed, then went for baron, maybe it could have worked. Instead, they chose to hit the turret a few times before backing off from enemy team respawning.
Here you can see a mistake. Going for turrets is correct, but not when the conditions aren't met. This is poor decision making. And Bronze players may be as mechanically skilled as Silver or Gold, but we lack in map and objective control.

It can't happen so often in every game. There comes a point where it's 50-50 between you and the enemy team, and if you are better than your laning opponent, you should win more and get out. I played on a B5 smurf. Games were as retarded as it gets. Yet, I was still able to easy carry with Irelia, even when my bottom lane was 0/15. You just need to attack the weaknesses that the bronzies have. One of the best things you can do is pick Jax and splitpush.
Theres always exceptions, its good that you know something that you could improve on. I'm kinda the same way with objectives

Yes you can solo carry lower elos. 
Easily. More  than in any other elo.

There are games that can't be salvaged. But that's not every single game. If you consistently go 10-0 in your lane, you can't really lose that many games.

I'm not a professional player, but the game shouldn't be entirely balanced on professional play. People who are not good at the game should still enjoy playing it. If you watch professional games now, the laning phase is practically not a thing. Mid gets roamed on 24/7, bot lane gets pounded by globals, and the game either ends early, or turns into whoever fucks up loses. And top lane is... tanks noodling each other.

Take a look at Game 3 of FNC vs. G2, even watching it is frustrating. Practically every lead is given by the jungler, Amazing gives Caps a good lead mid (practically ends any chance Perkz has of killing Caps in lane) Caps has all the pressure. Trick pressures bot and allows them to get first blood turret, and that snowballs their lead into mid, and then Ashe arrows just fuck the whole game catching people out.

The only way a bot lane first blood turret won't decide the game is if your scaling isn't as good as the other team, and you can't close out the game soon enough. Or you're severely worse than the enemy team.
